business.headline: Donald Trump's US Strategic Bitcoin Reserve. All you need to know With this executive order, President Trump reinforces his commitment to make the US the 'crypto capital of the world.'

Is the bull market dead? Ace investor Shankar Sharma cautions investors for 2025When questioned if small investors can bear losses like experienced traders, Sharma said that all successful investors once started small but grew by overcoming challenges.

Tariff uncertainty clobbers US markets, Nasdaq crashes 10%, S&P slidesStocks fell even though President Trump offered a one-month reprieve from his 25% tariffs on many goods imported from Mexico and Canada. That's unlike the bounce stocks got the prior day from his giving a one-month exemption specifically for automakers.

Britannia Industries CEO Rajneet Singh Kohli resignsKohli submitted his resignation on March 5, 2025, and the Board of Directors has taken note of it through a circular resolution passed on March 6, 2025. He will be relieved from his duties at the close of business hours on March 14, 2025.

While some experts remain cautious about calling this a full-fledged market recovery, they acknowledge that conditions are improving for a potential uptrend.

Delhi Mahila Samriddhi Scheme: Check if you are eligible for Rs 2,500 monthly aidThe Delhi government will launch an online portal where women can submit their applications. The IT department is also developing special software to verify eligibility.

US may push India for zero tariffs on nearly all goods: Report The development comes as US President Donald Trump keeps criticising India over what he calls 'unfair' trade practices. entertainment.headline: Shabana Azmi on Dabba Cartel, rise of OTT, and feminism in cinema. VideoAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Shabana Azmi spoke about her role in Dabba Cartel, emphasising that 'power can be quiet'. Co-creator Shibani Akhtar revealed that the concept was built around the idea of a "Shabana Azmi drug cartel" from the outset. The series presents a compelling narrative of women coming together in solidarity within a crime drama, with Azmi's nuanced and quiet yet powerful performance serving as its anchor. Her portrayal marks a significant thematic shift in Indian storytelling. Jyotika also shared her experience and connection to her character, highlighting how the roles reflect real-life struggles faced by women, as well as themes of feminism and women's emancipation.

Jyotika on working with Shabana Azmi in Dabba Cartel: She was a friend to usActor Jyotika was recently seen in the newly-released show Dabba Cartel. At India Today Conclave 2025, she spoke about her character in the crime drama, her camaraderie with Shabana Azmi and what drew her to Dabba Cartel.

Shabana Azmi, Jyotika and Shibani Dandekar open up about making Dabba Cartel. PicsDabba Cartel actors Shabana Azmi, Jyotika and creator Shibani Dandekar graced the India Today Conclave 2025 on Friday, where they shared their experience of creating the Netflix series.

Explained: The plagiarism controversy around BLACKPINK's Jennie's new song BLACKPINK member Jennie Kim released the teaser of her new single, 'Like Jennie', on social media, and several social media users, especially Indians, found it quite similar to Alia Bhatt's theme song from 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani'.

general news.headline: Congress failed Northeast for 65 years: Kiren Rijiju at India Today ConclaveUnion Minister Kiren Rijiju took a jibe at the Congress on Friday while speaking at the India Today Conclave 2025, saying that what the party failed to do in 65 years, the BJP did within a decade.

She made the remark while speaking at the India Today Conclave being held at Delhi's Taj Palace.

Mumbai animator dies by suicide, blames wife, aunt in note on company's websiteAccording to information, Nishanr Tripathi, originally from Palghar district, moved to the Sahara Hotel in Vile Parle, Mumbai, three days before he hung himself on February 28. England Cricket Board issues apology for 'ill-judged' Pope Francis jokeThe England and Wales Cricket Board faced backlash after joking about Pope Francis "loving the Ashes" in response to his Ash Wednesday message. The post was deleted, and ECB issued an apology for the insensitivity.

IND vs NZ: Virat Kohli's calmness gives Gautam Gambhir's India its ODI identityIn an era when every team needs to have an 'identity', India's ODI team under Gautam Gambhir is deriving its spirit from the calmness of Virat Kohli. The star batter has been in sensational form for India in the Champions Trophy.

UP Warriorz all but knocked out as Matthews, Kerr power MI to 6-wicket winHayley Matthews smashed a 46-ball 68, while Amelia Kerr registered her best figures of 5/38 as Mumbai Indians stormed to a six-wicket win over UP Warriorz in the Women's Premier League.

Mitchell Santner banking on form ahead of final, says extra travel part of jobNew Zealand skipper Mitchell Santner said that he was banking on his team's form ahead of the Champions Trophy final against India. New Zealand beat South Africa in a high-scoring contest to reach the summit clash.

Champions Trophy 2025 Final: ICC announces umpiring line-upPaul Reiffel and Richard Illingworth, two of the most respected names amongst the umpires are set to officiate the Champions Trophy Final between India and New Zealand on Sunday, March 9.

Champions Trophy: Team flops. Did Pakistan fare better as hosts?Pakistan are not playing the final of an ICC tournament, that they hosted after much drama. While their cricket team has been a failure, how did Pakistan do as the hosts of the Champions Trophy 2025?

Sunil Chhetri comes out of international retirement, to play in FIFA's March windowSunil Chhetri has performed a retirement U-turn as he will be back in India colours during the March international window, AIFF announced on March 6. Chhetri retired from football in 2024.

Ben Stokes as England white-ball captain? Rob Key says 'nothing's off the table'England's managing director of men's cricket Rob Key has hinted that Ben Stokes could be an option to be the new white-ball captain after their exit from the Champions Trophy. Jos Buttler stepped down from his role as captain following their exit from the tournament.

Shreyas ready to be India's X-factor in Champions Trophy final vs New ZealandWith an impeccable record against New Zealand in ODIs, Shreyas Iyer is all set to be India's X-factor in the final of the Champions Trophy on March 9. Shreyas goes up a gear against the Blackcaps when it comes to ICC events, as he has shown in the recent past.

Saud Shakeel oversleeps? 'Timed-Out' in Pakistan's President's Trophy FinalSaud Shakeel was dismissed in the oddest of manners in the President's Trophy in Pakistan. Shakeel was timed out after allegedly oversleeping in the dressing room.

India not at 100 percent despite reaching Champions Trophy final: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar feels that India are still not operating at their full potential despite reaching the final of the Champions Trophy 2025. India will face New Zealand in the summit clash on March 9 in Dubai.

No one should take New Zealand for granted in final against India: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has claimed that no one should be taking New Zealand for granted in the Champions Trophy final clash against India on March 9. Gavaskar feels that the clash on Sunday will be different from their previous clash during the Group stages.

Why Hardik Pandya was 'laughing inside' during high-pressure semi-final chaseHardik Pandya revealed that he was 'laughing' at the tensed Indian dressing room during the high-pressure run-chase against Australia in the semi-final of the Champions Trophy 2025. Hardik played a match-winning 28 off 24 balls to get India over the line.

David Miller on frequent travel between Pakistan and Dubai: It was not niceSouth Africa batter David Miller has said that it was not nice to shuttle between Pakistan and Dubai for the Champions Trophy. Miller opened up on the hassle of travelling right after playing a match in Pakistan and then flying back again after the draw for semis were finalised.

Why are sleeveless jerseys banned from presentation ceremonies? IPL 2025: The BCCI has introduced SOPs for all the 10 teams, one of which is prohibiting players from wearing 'floppies and sleeveless jerseys' at post-match presentation ceremonies.

Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat announces pregnancy: A new chapter in our storyIndian wrestler Vinesh Phogat has announced that she is expecting her first child with husband Somvir Rathee on her official Instagram account on Thursday, March 6. Vinesh announced her retirement from wrestling in 2024.

Don't try anything extra: When MS Dhoni calmed down a debuting Rahul TripathiRahul Tripathi recalled the moment when MS Dhoni helped him calm down ahead of his IPL debut in 2017. Dhoni and Tripathi were playing for Rising Pune Super Giants at that time in the IPL.

Choose your words carefully: Babar Azam's father slams criticsBabar Azam's father Azam Siddique slammed critics for their harsh criticism towards his son after Pakistan's poor performance in the Champions Trophy where they couldn't advance to the semis.

SRH rope in South Africa all-rounder for injured Brydon Carse IPL 2025: South African all-rounder Wiaan Mulder has replaced the injured Brydon Carse in the Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) for the upcoming edition of the tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
